resources.string: A small sample of treasures from a dragon's collection.
Washed ashore from the Eastern Sea, this armor was not damped nor sullied by the tides that beseeched it.
Washed ashore from the Eastern Sea, this armor was not damped nor sullied by the tides that beseeched it.
Washed ashore from the Eastern Sea, this armor was not damped nor sullied by the tides that beseeched it.

“Where the Rainbow ends, the Dragon begins.“
“Where the Rainbow ends, the Dragon begins.“
“Where the Rainbow ends, the Dragon begins.“
“Where the Rainbow ends, the Dragon begins.“
“Where the Rainbow ends, the Dragon begins.“
It is said that when the Dragon King descends from the Heavens, the dawn upon his back casts as radiant wings.
It is said that when the Dragon King descends from the Heavens, the dawn upon his back casts as radiant wings.
It is said that when the Dragon King descends from the Heavens, the dawn upon his back casts as radiant wings.
It is said that when the Dragon King descends from the Heavens, the dawn upon his back casts as radiant wings.
It is said that when the Dragon King descends from the Heavens, the dawn upon his back casts as radiant wings.
"His teeth, like icicles at the mouth of a cave, parted and unleashed a fowl blizzard that raged for thirty days and nights."
Legend tells of a young dragon whose greed was so great that he enveloped an unknown treasure with his own ice and body, only to be frozen solid along with it.
On a particularly cold day, the trail of its shot may linger as a cloud, like a single thread through the silken sky.
"And as the enemy breached, the brothers' blasted such a flurry of snow that it formed a towering wall over the kingdom and guarded it forevermore."
A monument to wintry leviathans, this pillar reaches towards the heavens to beckon their return.
When behind this screen, even the greatest inferno feels as a crisp January breeze.
It is said that the call of this gong once summoned dragons to fight at your side. No one knows why it stopped working.
A bundle of gifts to welcome you to spring.
The foul weather of Spring's first stirs and when the Cailleach awakens, winter shall have passed.
The prowling lynx emerges from her den, eager for a spring feast.
This beautiful piece of nature was formed, not carved, from native Aeternum Wildwood.
This thick rug was woven with great care to comfort one through the last days of Winter.
A sharp smell emanates from deep within, burning your eyes.
“See how the shadows flicker? Like skulking assassins.”
“See how the shadows flicker? Like skulking assassins.”
“See how the shadows flicker? Like skulking assassins.”
“See how the shadows flicker? Like skulking assassins.”
“See how the shadows flicker? Like skulking assassins.”
From the ashen depths burns the vigilant gaze of the Warden.
From the ashen depths burns the vigilant gaze of the Warden.
From the ashen depths burns the vigilant gaze of the Warden.
From the ashen depths burns the vigilant gaze of the Warden.
From the ashen depths burns the vigilant gaze of the Warden.
“From the ashes he rose and within his heart burned a smoldering twilight.”
“From the ashes he rose and within his heart burned a smoldering twilight.”
“From the ashes he rose and within his heart burned a smoldering twilight.”
“From the ashes he rose and within his heart burned a smoldering twilight.”
“From the ashes he rose and within his heart burned a smoldering twilight.”
Its arrows whistle like sparkling rockets.
“A gust unfurled it’s scarlet wings, then dissolved into fluttering ash that singed the amber sky.”
A faint light embers on its surface.
“...and as they clashed, the sparks flew and revolutions once envisioned were now inevitable.”
Cauterize the wound as you cut.
A faint light embers on its surface.
A guiding light in even the deepest black.
“Be the blaze that brings light to the morrow.”
As heavy as an anvil; as hot as the forge.
Lost souls crave the warmth of its glow.
It’s said that on a stormy night, its light can shine brighter and further than any lighthouse.
A faint light embers on its surface.
Nothing burns quite like absolute zero.
The thick leather protects you from its immense ambient heat, but not everyone else.
Be wary of the forking fire.
If flipped and modified, a lamp post can make a decent fishing rod.
Combining a lantern and a pickaxe is dangerous, but convenient.
The heat in which it was forged still lingers in its blade.
Somewhere out in the burning sands is a rolling storm of crackling lightning and this drum carries its growl.
Strumming this guitar is like rekindling with an old friend; every note is warm and comforting.
The belly of this bass echoes like a lonely flame burning deep in the quiet earth.
While intimidating and wild, this warm-hearted guardian is loyal and surprisingly cuddly.
This shadowbox pulls you in, as if inviting you into the heart of Brimstone.
A fixed lamp that casts shadows similar to swaying acrobats.
A table-side lamp that houses what appear to be small, writhing dancers.
A standing lantern that brightens the room as if filled with vibrant performers.
This gilded grating creates a shrine of the fire that brings warmth to the home.
The fibers of this rug are particularly warm, like if it had soaked in all the warmth of the setting sun.
Illuminate the night from within this cozy yurt capable of repelling even the harshest Aeternum winds.
Light shines in from all directions, filling its space with an inviting glow.
Where these items came from isn't important. What matters is they're yours now!
Creaking and scrapping, as if rust from bone; arise.
Creaking and scrapping, as if rust from bone; arise.
Creaking and scrapping, as if rust from bone; arise.
Creaking and scrapping, as if rust from bone; arise.

A strain between integrity and indecency, feasting upon the living like parasites and the dead like fungi. Such is the nature of a scoundrel.

When adorned in glittering riches from head to toe, does it truly matter from whence it came? After all, they’re mine now.

Don't let its worn appearance fool you - it has a nasty kick.
Proof that the gentry don't have a monopoly on fencing.
Some might call the cold a mercy, though it's debatable.
Whether or not this shield has seen better days is really a matter of perspective.
The sharp, serrated teeth were a nice touch to an otherwise verily lethal hatchet.
What is of more value than the most dangerous game?
Protect your privacy from trapezing lumberjacks.
A fine kill. Not yours, mind you, but a fine one nonetheless.
Now that you think about it, you've yet to see foxes in Aeternum...
After bloodily persevering savage foes and feral animals, relish in a twee bubble bath.

The gothic design harkens back to antiquity, to a time of galantry and bloodshed.
The formidable design harkens back to antiquity, to a time of bravery and battle.
The elegant design harkens back to antiquity, to a time of passion and fire.

The commanding design harkens back to antiquity, to a time of chivalry and sovereignty.
The venerable design harkens back to antiquity, to a time of honor and glory.

The land provides - but so do the waters, if you know where to look.
A rugged implement meant to withstand the fury of nature and humankind alike.
Better used for trees, but sharp enough for other uses.
Unearth Aeternum's undiscovered treasures. Or at least some precious minerals.
For a different sort of reaping away from the field of battle.
Waste not - all parts of your quarry are useful in their own way.
Everything you need for venturing into the vast unknown.
The salt crust of prolonged submersion further protected its long-lost contents.

The sea strikes without warning, and so too shall you.
The sea's waters offer life, and so too shall you.
The sea stops for no one, and neither shall you.
The sea's depths crush all, and so too shall you.

Only truer than their aim was their love. May they rest in peace.
Unyielding to even death. May they rest in peace.
Their flame burns eternal and ever bright. May they rest in peace.
Once and always a defender from evil. May they rest in peace.
Always wanted to go out with a 'bang'. May they rest in peace.

All that glitters is not gold, but can be equally precious.
Unfailing protection in a surprisingly light package.
Whatever you do, make sure you're not the one it stings.

Lethal beauty in the palm of your hand, and the flanks of your foes.
Surely the fish won't be able to resist this impressive work of artisanry.
An elegant tool adorned in gilded branch and vine motif.
Deceptively delicate in appearance, but absolutely up to the task.
The leaflike blade is reminiscent of the very items it is meant to harvest.
Some skinners favor shorter blades such as this for their most precise work.
Drink deep of the wine-dark sea, and embrace the power held within.
Long have you known fathoms below contain unspeakable wonders - and now, they rest in your palms.
